bugs.title: CVE-2024-41015 kernel: ocfs2: add bounds checking to ocfs2_check_dir_entry() [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-41015 kernel: ocfs2: add bounds checking to ocfs2_check_dir_entry() [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-41015 kernel: ocfs2: add bounds checking to ocfs2_check_dir_entry()

long_desc.thetext:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

ocfs2: add bounds checking to ocfs2_check_dir_entry()

This adds sanity checks for ocfs2_dir_entry to make sure all members of
ocfs2_dir_entry don't stray beyond valid memory region.

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2300866]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2300298

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# testing, stable

bugs.title: CVE-2024-41019 kernel: fs/ntfs3: Validate ff offset [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-41019 kernel: fs/ntfs3: Validate ff offset [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-41019 kernel: fs/ntfs3: Validate ff offset

long_desc.thetext:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

fs/ntfs3: Validate ff offset

This adds sanity checks for ff offset. There is a check
on rt->first_free at first, but walking through by ff
without any check. If the second ff is a large offset.
We may encounter an out-of-bound read.

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2300890]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2300302

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-41021 kernel: s390/mm: Fix VM_FAULT_HWPOISON handling in do_exception() [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-41021 kernel: s390/mm: Fix VM_FAULT_HWPOISON handling in do_exception() [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-41021 kernel: s390/mm: Fix VM_FAULT_HWPOISON handling in do_exception()

long_desc.thetext:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

s390/mm: Fix VM_FAULT_HWPOISON handling in do_exception()

There is no support for HWPOISON, MEMORY_FAILURE, or ARCH_HAS_COPY_MC on
s390. Therefore we do not expect to see VM_FAULT_HWPOISON in
do_exception().

However, since commit af19487f00f3 ("mm: make PTE_MARKER_SWAPIN_ERROR more
general"), it is possible to see VM_FAULT_HWPOISON in combination with
PTE_MARKER_POISONED, even on architectures that do not support HWPOISON
otherwise. In this case, we will end up on the BUG() in do_exception().

Fix this by treating VM_FAULT_HWPOISON the same as VM_FAULT_SIGBUS, similar
to x86 when MEMORY_FAILURE is not configured. Also print unexpected fault
flags, for easier debugging.

Note that VM_FAULT_HWPOISON_LARGE is not expected, because s390 cannot
support swap entries on other levels than PTE level.

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2300897]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2300364

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable

======

bugs.title: CVE-2024-41020 kernel: filelock: Fix fcntl/close race recovery compat path [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-41020 kernel: filelock: Fix fcntl/close race recovery compat path [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-41020 kernel: filelock: Fix fcntl/close race recovery compat path

long_desc.thetext:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

filelock: Fix fcntl/close race recovery compat path

When I wrote commit 3cad1bc01041 ("filelock: Remove locks reliably when
fcntl/close race is detected"), I missed that there are two copies of the
code I was patching: The normal version, and the version for 64-bit offsets
on 32-bit kernels.
Thanks to Greg KH for stumbling over this while doing the stable
backport...

Apply exactly the same fix to the compat path for 32-bit kernels.

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2300901]
Upstream advisory: https://lore.kernel.org/linux-cve-announce/2024072927-CVE-2024-41020-52c6@gregkh/

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2300363

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.
